alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:55PM MST until January 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE FOOTHILLS... .Snow will continue to impact the foothills through this evening, with a few inches of additional accumulation expected, and locally treacherous road conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 3-8 inches in the southwest foothills. 1-3" in the Larimer County foothills. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, and The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. Snow tapering off considerably after 9 or 10 PM, from north to south. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
